headline: Very Easy Mushroom Barley Soup
description: This delicious mushroom barley soup with carrots, onions, celery, and garlic is cooked in less than an hour for a hearty meal on a cold day.
name: Very Easy Mushroom Barley Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, celery and garlic; cook and stir until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in mushrooms and continue to cook for about 3 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth, add barley, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until barley is tender, about 50 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

review.reviewBody: This recipe was simple and easy to make with regular ingredients you have on hand. It didn't take long and was delicious.
Added some chopped Russian kale. Yummy recipe.
I made this using Trixie T’s variation and also added chicken. Super hardy.
Very hearty, filling and delicious!
We loved this soup! I used beef broth since that is what I had on hand. Very tasty.

I made this with chicken bone broth w/chicken base added(1 tsp. per cup). I used 2 T butter instead of OO. Blended about 1/4 lb mushrooms with some of the broth, and added back to the soup. Doubled garlic, and used red onion instead of yellow. Delicious! This soup would even be good without the barley(add more veggies), if you are counting calories.

I loved it! I agree with posters on other recipes that you should review the recipe AS IS instead of tweaking it. More on that in a minute. I made it exactly as instructed but I did use pearled barley which cut the cooking time. ( Okay this is a tweak lol) My husband pulled out the mushrooms which he dislikes but loved it. Regarding tweaking. I love to read reviews and some the reviewers tweaks have made a recipe much better. In this case, I used low/ no sodium broth as I am sodium restricted. I was afraid I'd hate it. It was spectacular.
Definitely will make this recipe again. I did added some chopped spinach.
Delicious and Nutritious I added ½ tsp garlic salt and ½ tsp black pepper Look at the nutrition label amazing

I like how easy it is. When time is against you and it's cold outside this is a perfect, hearty and simple soup to make. The hardest thing here to do is prep the veg! With 3 celiac daughters I subbed round brown rice for the barley to make it gluten free. Also added a bay leaf and about a 1/4 tsp of thyme.

Enjoyed making this soup, easy. I did make a few changes, presoaked pearl barley about 1 hour in small bowl. Also I used 1 box low sodium chicken broth (32 ounce), 14 oz can of tomatoes(chopped them by hand) , 1/2 cup red wine and a bay leaf which I later removed. Came out delicious!
Yummy
Delicious and so easy to make! I’ll make this again often.

I liked the broth from this soup. The soup was good. I love mushrooms, but I think I need to cut them up smaller for this soup. The larger mushrooms seemed to bother me in this soup. I think since I'm so used to eating soups with meat, this felt like it was missing something. I might consider adding diced chicken breast in the future.

Fabulous! Just the taste and consistency I wanted. I posted it on a Facebook group page for Jewish food and received over 200 comments and numerous requests for the recipe. Note: when reheating add more chicken broth.
This soup was very easy and delicious. Next time I want to try beef broth in place of the chicken broth.
I made this recipe as written. I didn’t measure the chopped onions or garlic, so I may have added more. We liked this recipe and it was easy to make. Will definitely make again.

I knew right away that I wanted half chicken broth and half beef, but it was so bland and boring. To make it edible, I added Lawry's season salt, garlic powder, rosemary, dill weed, a couple splashes of Worcester, and a couple splashes of lite soy sauce. I will probably not make this again.
Just as the name says, very easy to make.
I made it as the first thing I made in an InstantPot. It came out perfect.

I love this soup and make it often. Everyone loves it. The first time, I followed the recipe exactly. Since then, I use enough olive oil to saute the veg; 1 or 2 Tablespoons. 1/4 Cup of oil is way too much. Even beloved olive oil is straight fat, remember. This soup is a winner!
So easy and delicious. I doubled it and froze half of the batch. Excellent recipe.

This is a great, easy recipe that anyone can build on to personal tastes and likes. I added pieces of freshly bought rotisserie chicken making it more hearty and a dinner entree. 
 Much thanks to Trixie T. and her tips as published which I used exactly but added at least 6-8 cloves of chopped garlic and doubled the Parsley leaves and added 1-2 oz of the white wine. Kudos to suggesting 3 cups each of both chicken and beef broth; really makes a difference including each of the dry herbs noted in your tips. Made the kitchen smell fantastic and the soup simply ultra delicious. A recipe to hold onto.

I love this soup! I've made it countless times by now. I have a fairly fussy toddler and she refuses most food. She'll take doubles of this soup so I'm always thrilled to make it because of its nutritional content. The only trick I would add is to use INSTANT barley, which cuts down cooking time by at least half, and never leaves me with par-done barley.

Just made this, and its delicious! I doubled the recipe because I like to can up the extra for use later. I used 2 lbs of mushrooms, 1 whole large yellow onion, 3 cloves garlic, 1 large carrot, 2 celery stalks, 8 cups homemade chicken stock and 4 cups beef bouillon, 2 cups barley. I added about 1 Tbsp dried thyme, 1 Tbsp dried parsley, about 3/8 cup white cooking wine, 1 bay leaf. I simmered for one hour, it had a great consistency, but the flavor seemed to need an extra punch. I added about a tsp of garlic salt, and then the flavor was what I was hoping for. Delicious. I'll make this again!
Like any soup it’s only as good as the ingredients. This soup is simple and delicious. I do not use stock. Only water and salt. The vegetables flavor the water. Try it next time you make a soup.

Delicious! I used cremini mushrooms, rehydrated onions and garlic (because I do not like chopping them), and Not-Chick'n bouillon. Sprinkled smoked paprika on top and added 1 tablespoon of cumin. Turned out great. Oh, and I use vegan Chick'n salt to season.
Made everything the same

I made some changes:
I used beef broth instead of chicken, upped the barley to 1 cup, upped the amount of veggies, peeled, diced up and added a parsnip and a rutabaga for extra flavor (I love root veggies in winter), added herbes de Provence and tarragon to the salt and pepper
I’ve made it three times.

Made it exactly as the recipe called for/ Added about a half teaspoon of salt and it was perfect. I used a mix of sliced cremini and ordinary white mushrooms. I think it was actually better the next day after being in the fridge overnight. The stock seemed to thicken, probably a result of the barley soaking in the soup. Definitely will become a staple inner household.
I added more carrots and I’d probably use less oil next time but it was delicious. You really don’t need much salt at all if you spice it up with pepper.
I used barley I cooked last month and had in the freezer. The soup was delicious. I will be making this again.
added 2 cups of water, would use a little less barley, added some cut up chuck meat

I made this tonight and it was delicious. I used half chicken broth and half beef broth. I also used a rib steak I had in the freezer, cubed and browned it and added to the pot. Thats the only changes I made. After the barley had swelled I added another can of chicken of chicken broth because I like it to be a little soupy. I’ll definitely make this again.
Didn't have celery, did have sauerkraut, added a sourness to it. Added some baco-n-buds for some crunch. Also I love hot so used sirache
Delicious, next time I will add chicken ir turkey breast.

Easy and very tasty. I added some dried shitake mushrooms, dash of thyme and a bay leaf. Also substituted the chicken broth with a veggie broth to keep it vegetarian and used 1 cup pearl barley soaked for quicker cooking. Used my Instant Pot pressure cooker. Sauteed, then soup setting for 25 minutes, cooldown 10 minutes then vented and removed cover. Perfect!
my family loved it.
Friends, and family LOVE this soup. I just made a double batch. It's easy, and consistently delicious. On occasion I add a can of corn kernels near the end.

We followed the recipe and added some chicken and bullion to give it more chicken flavor and some protein. We underseasoned it initially and suggest you not skimp on salt and pepper. You need to really like mushrooms if you follow the recipe. Next time we will season it more and halve the mushrooms, there will still be plenty.
The second time I made it, I added a large can of crushed tomatoes and it turned it into more of a stew which I also liked.

I agree with previous review, added extra garlic, and onions, and some red wine as I was cooking the mushrooms. Oh, I also used beef broth instead of chicken. The wine really gave the soup great depth, and definitely use pearled barley!

This soup was so tasty and if I hadn't been an idiot, it would have turned out perfect. I put in way too much barley because honestly I couldn't even see it when I put in a cup. After it cooled, it became a solid block. Yeah, I'm not the most patient cook.
I did get to eat some of it before and it was wonderful. I used a mix of button and crimini mushrooms and about double the garlic. Very yummy. But don't add too much barley no matter how much you want to.
Very tasty and easy
I made no changes, delicious and very easy. I did toast the barley as a few others suggested, this is very hearty and tasty. This will go into my soup rotation.
Yes I added gwashington boulion to the soup it was very good. Yes I would make it again and again
Less mushrooms & cut them up very fine.

Wonderful soup! Took another reviewer's advice and roasted the barley prior to tossing into pot with the rest of the veggies and broth. Decreased oil to 2 TBLS & added a few teaspoons of dried herbs such as basil, savory & thyme. Perfect with a dash of salt and pepper added after cooking up. This recipe is very easy to spruce up with extra veggies and/or barley so don't be afraid to vary it. The barley will add thickness to the soup, especially after cooking for an hour and setting up overnight. Even my finicky family members enjoyed this.

Wonderful soup! Took another reviewer's advice and roasted the barley prior to tossing into pot with the rest of the veggies and broth. Decreased oil to 2 TBLS & added a few teaspoons of dried herbs such as basil, savory & thyme. Perfect with a dash of salt and pepper added after cooking up. This recipe is very easy to spruce up with extra veggies and/or barley so don't be afraid to vary it. The barley will add thickness to the soup, especially after cooking for an hour and setting up overnight. Even my finicky family members enjoyed this.
It is simmering now. Smells great. Added extra onions and mushrooms. Used a heavily herbed leftover chicken to make the broth. Thanks just what I needed on a cold November day
It's very cold in Utah unless you have a cup of delicious Mushroom/Barley soup in your hands!

Outstanding. I need to find low carb / low cholesterol recipes that don't have foods I'm allergic to and have foods I like. This for the bill beautifully! I doubled the recipe (because I hate cooking and try to always have leftovers after feeding the masses) and cooked some ground chicken to add to it (1 pound per recipe). I also added a couple dashes of ginger and a couple bay leaves because I know I like those things in chicken broth based soups. Everyone loved it and I'm happy to have a recipe that my Dr approves of that I actually enjoy eating!.
I made the broth from sodium free chicken broth packets, to lower my salt intake
This turned out great! I omitted the carrots because I didn’t have any, added a 14.5 oz can of low sodium white beans and used a no salt vegetable broth. I will make it again.
Nice soup I made a large batch and froze portions for my hubby
I have made this soup Several times and just love it. I use the 10 minute barley instead and it’s perfect.
I used "Instant Barley" so I added the barley with only 15 minutes left to simmer. It turned out great. I'm definitely keeping this on my "short" list.
All I did was up the barley to 1 cup and added some cornstarch to thicken it at the end. Wonderful taste! Used up all the veggies I had. What could be better?
Made the recipe as is except used low sodium chicken broth. Very tasty and easy!
so easy to make this classic soup

Absolutely delicious!! I made a double batch of this and couldn't stop eating it for days. I even froze a container of the leftovers. I hope it reheats well. 

So simple, but so very very yummy.

This was absolutely delicious. The only change that I made, was that I added 1 small zucchini.
My guests loved every bite!!
So easy and so delicious. I made it with 20 out of mushrooms because I always want more mushrooms and I also added a can of chick peas for protein.

I used this recipe as a base and went crazy... I added I didn't have enough onions so I added Leek and scallions, I also added Shitake and oyster mushrooms and my own homemade stock and diced potatoes. It really came out hearty.
Excellent, easy, all ingredients on hand recipe. I needed more than the recipe would yield but not enough to double. It still was delicious.

So I did make changes because I was using it as a base for a soup that I was trying to recreate from many years ago, the mushroom barley soup served in NY delis. To do this I read the reviews & added the 2 bay leaves , 1 tsp each thyme & marjoram, dash worstershire. I upped the celery & carrot & added a parsnip since I had on hand. Then I added a few squats of the concentrated tomato paste in the tube plus I took a 1 oz. container of Dried mushrooms which I simmered in water to cover @ the beginning of the soup making process. After about 3/4 hr I turned it off & let it sit for a while longer. Added to the soup ingredients upon starting to cook the soup. These mushrooms take a while to cook..Actually turned out better than I remembered.
I loved this! I did double up the spices and use thyme. We had a lot of turkey left over from the holidays. So I added about 12oz and it was perfect.
This was a very easy and delicious recipe. The carnivore in me wants to add some beef, and I probably will next time.
Very good and delicious.
Made on top the stove with fresh spinach. Didn’t have spicy Italian sausage so I added a pinch or two of red pepper flakes while frying. We loved it!
Made exactly as in the recipe ! Turned out great, very tasty.
I used beef broth instead of chicken, and we all loved it, will definitely be making it again.
Great barley soup! Didn't change a thing except added about 2 tbls Worcester sauce.
Great recipe and easy as well. I added a Bay Leaf and a bit of thyme.

This is now one of my favorite soups! I love mushrooms, but tire of the same old cream of mushroom soups. I used vegetable broth, one full cup of barley, and added 1/4 cup dry white wine and 1/4 tsp parsley. Next time, I will add more garlic, more parsley, and extra pepper while cooking.
I'd give it 6 stars if I could! This was fast, easy and delicious . I followed the recipe exactly but using this as a base the possibilities are endless. Try it you won't be disappointed .
Made with beef broth vs chicken broth. Easy and quick and very good.

I made it exactly as written. I used hull-less barley which seemed to cook within the designated cooking time. The name of the soup is mushroom barley yet there were many more mushrooms than there was barley. I think the barley should probably be doubled. I also was surprised that there was more onion than there was celery or carrot. I would give it a 5 for being easy to make and having a low calorie count.
Incredibly easy recipe. As recommended in reviews I first toasted the barley. My cousins loved it and requested the recipe.
I didn't soak the barley, and by mistake left the soup on the stove at low heat when I went out to a lecture. It cooked for about 3 hours and was absolutely delicious!

I added cubed chicken breast into the soup to cook. I also only had 8 oz. mushrooms and it was still very good. I put in more carrots and just a little more barely to compensate. Next time I would like to try it with beef broth---especially if making it without meat.

Boyfriend and I loved this hearty soup. Followed reviewer advice and pre-toasted the barley. Also added 1/4 tsp each of thyme and parsley and threw in some shredded roasted chicken. Definitely will make again. Enjoy!
Love it quick and easy
Great recipe and very easy to prepare. I didn't change a thing. I made this for my Dad who is on a renal diet (low sodium) and it was delicious! I am making another pot for my family this week.
So Easy & So Yummy!

Great base recipe for newer cooks looking to branch out from making soups into making stews. Turned out very thick so I'd consider reducing the amount of mushroom used to 400g next time, and you definitely don't need that much olive oil. I added some coriander, black pepper, rosemary and thyme and am glad of it now as it may have been a bit bland otherwise.
Loved it, easy to make!

I added more onion, carrots and celery, but that is all. It was absolutely wonderful. I will definitely make it again. Oh, and I just realized as I was reading other reviews, how anyone could call it bland, but I used portabella mushrooms instead of white b/c that is what I had.

Really, really enjoyed this soup and my uncle raved about it! Used all beef broth since I think mushrooms go better with it and I also omitted the celery.Also took some suggestions from some other reviewers and used less oil, added some red wine and used a full cup of barley. Reheated well also and was super easy to make. Will definitely become a staple in my house.
Very easy to make. I omitted the celery cause I don't like it. The soup turned out great

I made this with pearl barley and my own chicken stock and added some dried and fresh herbs. I honestly did not measure the carrots etc but did approximate per the recipe. I gave some away to friends that were in need of comforting (both had a parent pass away within a day of each other) and I had plenty for myself. It was very good and I got thanked by both friends who said it was wonderful. Im going to make it again with hulled barley and again, use my own gelled chicken stock (from pastured local chicken bones). So it takes me actually days to make soup, but most of that time Im doing other things (soaking barley and making the stock in a crockpot) Im bringing a batch with me next week on a visit with friends in their vacation home in the Poconos. I gave them options and was told mushroom barley is their fav. Im seeing reviews saying its bland but it is very comforting ~ probably moreso with homemade stock ~ and it's easy to add a little flavor with small amount of herbs. I think I used dried thyme and at the end, added fresh parsley.

Gave it 3 stars. We ate a little & then added some red wine like others had suggested & it became a 4 star. Will make again with red wine now. It is nice not having meat all the time, nice change. I also used quick barley which was mentioned also. You don't need to cook as long & I did use the same amount of barley which I wasn't sure about doing at first. You can always add more carrots, celery & mushrooms per your preference.

It was okay. Isaac liked it better than me. I doubled the garlic and added 1 tsp each of dried thyme, marjoram, and parsley and 2 Tb. white cooking wine per another reviewer's suggestion. It was still pretty bland. I ended up adding a bunch more salt, pepper, and a harris teeter hand-grind signature spice blend to liven it up. Turned out okay but wouldn't make it again.

I followed the recipe exactly. I truly LOVED it! Since I made too much, I put some in individual containers and froze them, thawed one at a time overnight in the fridge, took it to work the next day, microwaved it for my lunch. Lunch was very tasty, but since the barley soaked up more broth, it was much thicker. Thick or not... WOW what flavor, Who needs meat when there are mushrooms in the world?!

Made this soup as I was coming off a bad 10-day viral infection with not much in the house and therefore made with only the 3 basic ingredients, i.e. mushrooms, barley and chicken broth. It was beyond easy and fabulous. Will be making this often during these winter months and will try it with the rest of the ingredients next time, though I'm unsure how it can be improved on.
Loved this soup! Will definitely make it again. I didn't have chicken stock so made it with beef. Otherwise, I followed the recipe. Delicious

Great recipe! I made this tonight as it is cold and snowing. It is perfect for this weather. I used 8 oz of white mushrooms and 8 oz of baby portabellas (cause that's what I had). I did up the carrots to 1 cup and same with the celery (I'm not good at figuring out how much I'll need and chopped away) and upped the garlic to 1 tablespoon (I love garlic!). No problem. Unfortunately I also upped the barley (I used Medium Barley and simmered for 50 min) to 1 cup which made it more like a thick stew. But the taste was great after adding salt and pepper to my taste. Next time I'll keep the barley to 3/4 cup. After a few bites I added 2 pinches of dried thyme to see how it changed it and it really did, I'm not saying good or bad but it was different. Thank you for a great recipe!

I will make this again and my vegetarian son loved it! I did add a little red pepper flakes, sirarcha sauce, cumin and smokey BBQ sauce for extra heat and flavor - but it was delicious and yummy before I added anything else. At the suggestion of one of the other home cooks, I added some baby spinach right at the end for color (and a nutritional boost)!
